definitions.example: They deepened the well by 200 feet.

definitions.definition: To make darker or more intense; to darken
definitions.example: The event deepened the prevailing gloom.

definitions.definition: To make more poignant or affecting; to increase in degree
definitions.example: News of her death deepened my sorrow.
The tuner deepened the tone of the organ.

definitions.definition: To make more thorough or extensive.
definitions.example: The class deepened my understanding of the subject.
The shared experiences deepened our relationship.

definitions.definition: To make more sound or heavy.
definitions.example: The hypnotist then proceeded to deepen his trance.
The water deepens as you go toward the middle of the channel.

definitions.definition: To become darker or more intense
definitions.example: The crisis deepened in the following weeks.

definitions.definition: To become more thorough or extensive.
definitions.example: His skill in deciphering the texts deepened with practice.
The conversation deepened and they began to truly share.

definitions.definition: To become more sound or heavy.
definitions.example: The new bed allowed my sleep to deepen.
